assessmentItem.title: Simplify surds to the form a^p b^q c^r

itemBody.div:
in the form
iL p
iM q
iN r
\[\qv{iL}^p\qv{iM}^q\qv{iN}^r\]
where p, q and r are fractions in their lowest terms.

feedbackBlock.p: You have had three attempts at answering this question, so here is the solution:

feedbackBlock.div: Roots can be expressed as fractional indices, and we can apply the rules for combining powers:

So
p = mFracL
\[p=\qv{mFracL}\]
,
q = mFracM
\[q=\qv{mFracM}\]
and
r = mFracN
\[r=\qv{mFracN}\]

div.p: Remember that roots correspond to fractional indices and apply the rules for combining powers.

feedbackBlock.p: Since you have viewed the solution, your score for this question will be 0.
Since you have viewed the hint, your score for this question will be halved.
